definition: to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: We also the emotional quotient is not too low, resistance from many in terms.
sentences.chinese: 我們的情緒智商還不算太低，抗拒來自多次中計。

sentences.english: Study the question for incorporating weather effects in bulk power system adequacy evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 研究電網可靠性評估中計及氣候條件因素的問題。

sentences.english: The Obama administration, unfortunately, is taking the bait by announcing that it will loosen those restrictions.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬當局宣佈放寬這些限制，不幸中計。

sentences.english: I was trapped into telling the police all I knew.
sentences.chinese: 我中計了，把所有知道的一切全告訴了公安。

sentences.english: In wake up before, usually once or more in the process of.
sentences.chinese: 在醒覺之前，通常都會有一次或以上的中計過程。

sentences.english: Mary set a trap for Peter and he really fell into the trap.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗給彼特設了個圈套，而他真中計了。

definition: to remain unmoved
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
material evidence
reparations/to pay reparations
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to fail to grasp the main points
to live together in harmony
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to damn/to curse/to revile
to offer evidence
